Serialized Form

  • Package arena

    • Class arena.BattleBotArena extends javax.swing.JPanel implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • PAUSE_FLASH_TIME

          int PAUSE_FLASH_TIME
          How fast the clock flashes when game paused

        • FLASH_TIME

          int FLASH_TIME
          How fast the red circles flash in test mode

        • WAIT_TO_START

          int WAIT_TO_START
          State constant to signal we are between rounds

        • GAME_ON

          int GAME_ON
          State constant to signal that the game is on

        • GAME_OVER

          int GAME_OVER
          State constant to signal that we are between rounds

        • GAME_PAUSED

          int GAME_PAUSED
          State constant to signal that the game is paused

        • WINNER

          int WINNER
          State constant to signal game over and winner declared

        • TEST_MODE

          int TEST_MODE
          State constant to signal we are in test mode (starts in this mode)

        • NAME_FONT

          int NAME_FONT
          Size of the bot names

        • STATS_FONT

          int STATS_FONT
          Size of the stats font (stats displayed at end of each round)

        • NUM_FRAMES

          int NUM_FRAMES
          Number of frames in the buffer for instant replay (limited by heap size)

        • REPLAY_SPEED

          int REPLAY_SPEED
          Ticks per frame in replay mode. Higher for a slower replay.

        • END_FRAME_COUNT

          int END_FRAME_COUNT
          How many frames to hold on the last frame before restarting the instant replay.

        • fanfareSoundFile

          File name for fanfare sound (plays at start of round)

          java.lang.String stopSoundFile
          File name for stop sound (plays when pausing game)

        • gameOverSoundFile

          java.lang.String gameOverSoundFile
          File name for game over sound

        • overheatSoundFile

          java.lang.String overheatSoundFile
          File name for overheat sound

        • showNames

          boolean showNames
          If set to true, the arena will display Bot names during the game.

        • showScores

          boolean showScores
          If set to true, the arena will display Bot scores during the game.

          If set to true, the arena will display Bot team names during the game.

          For dragging a bot (test mode)

        • state

          int state
          The main state variable - controls what phase of the game we are at (see the State constants)

        • ready

          boolean ready
          Used when going into test mode - false while bots are being set up, constructors called, etc.

          Overheated Bot image

        • startTime

          long startTime
          For timing the game length

        • pauseTime

          long pauseTime
          For continuing correct timing after a pause

        • nanoTimeCorrection

          double nanoTimeCorrection
          On some machines, System.nanoTime() returns incorrect results. For example, on one machine System.currentTimeMillis() shows 10 seconds elapsed while System.nanoTime() consistently shows 4.5 seconds elapsed for the same time period. The more reliable millisecond timing is used for the game clock, however for timing CPU usage of the Bots, we need a higher grain than 1ms. So System.nanoTime() is used, but a correction factor is computed in a thread spawned at startup time, and this becomes a multiplier for the number of ns that System.nanoTime() reports has elapsed.

        • timePlayed

          double timePlayed
          Total time played

        • df

          java.text.DecimalFormat df
          Object for formatting decimals

        • df2

          java.text.DecimalFormat df2
          Object for formatting decimals

        • gameTimer

          javax.swing.Timer gameTimer
          The main game engine timer

        • bots

          Bot[] bots
          Main array of Bot objects. Note that bots, botsInfo, and bullets are related arrays - bullets[i] gives the array of bullets owned by bot[i], and botsInfo[i] gives the public info for bot[i].

        • botsInfo

          BotInfo[] botsInfo
          Array of public info regarding the Bots - this is how information is passed to the Bots in getMove(). Done this way so the Bots don't have access to each others' internal states. Note that bots, botsInfo, and bullets are related arrays - bullets[i] gives the array of bullets owned by bot[i], and botsInfo[i] gives the public info for bot[i].

        • bullets

          Bullet[][] bullets
          The bullets. Note that bots, botsInfo, and bullets are related arrays - bullets[i] gives the array of bullets owned by bot[i], and botsInfo[i] gives the public info for bot[i].

        • botsLeft

          int botsLeft
          Number of bots remaining in the round.

        • messages

          java.util.LinkedList<E> messages
          Message buffer

        • replayImages

          java.awt.Image[] replayImages
          The images to use in instant replay. This is a circular buffer.

        • replayEndFrame

          int replayEndFrame
          The latest frame. The head pointer of the circular buffer called replayImages.

        • replayCurrentFrame

          int replayCurrentFrame
          In instant replay mode, this is the frame we are currently presenting.

        • endFrameCounter

          int endFrameCounter
          Counter for holding on the last frame before resetting the instant replay.

        • replayCounter

          int replayCounter
          Counter for deciding when to advance the frame during an instant replay.

        • imagesToLoad

          java.util.LinkedList<E> imagesToLoad
          This is a buffer that holds the images the Bots are requesting to load. Since bots don't have access to the arena as an image observer, the images in this list are painted off screen until g.drawImage() returns true. This ensures that all images get loaded ASAP whether the Bots are using them or not, and that callbacks happen and trigger a repaint when images are loaded.

        • death

          java.applet.AudioClip death
          Holds an audioclip for arena sound.

          Holds an audioclip for arena sound.

          Holds an audioclip for arena sound.
